member.name: Windows.PathProcessCommand
member.summary: Deprecated. Processes a string that contains a command line and generates a suitably quoted string, with arguments attached if required.
member.param: A pointer to a null-terminated string that contains the command line to process.

Pointer to a buffer that receives a null-terminated Unicode string with the appropriate quotation marks. To determine how large this buffer must be, set this parameter to NULL. The function returns the required buffer size.
The maximum number of characters that can be put in pszDest, not including the terminating null character. If this value is too small, the function fails.

param.name: dwFlags
param.para: Flags that control the procedure. One or more of the following values:
Add quotes if the path requires them.
Append trailing arguments to the output string. This value includes PPCF_ADDQUOTES.
Do not match the input string against folders, only against file objects.
Always choose the longest possible executable name.

member.returns: Returns a positive value if successful. If lpDest is set to NULL, the function returns the required buffer size in characters, including the terminating null character. If the call fails, the function returns a negative value.

member.name: Windows.SHChangeNotifyRegisterThread
member.summary: Enables asynchronous register and deregister of a thread.
member.param: Indicates whether the function is being used to register or deregister the thread. One of the values of .

member.name: Windows.SHMultiFileProperties
member.summary: Displays a merged property sheet for a set of files. Property values common to all the files are shown while those that differ display the string (multiple values).
member.param: A pointer to a data object that supplies the PIDLs of all of the files for which to display the merged property sheet. The data object must use the CFSTR_SHELLIDLIST clipboard format. The parent folder's implementation of must return a fully qualified file system path for each item in response to the flag.
member.returns: If this function succeeds, it returns S_OK. Otherwise, it returns an HRESULT error code.

member.name: Windows.SHRunControlPanel

summary.div: Note This function is not supported as of Windows Vista

member.param: Pointer to a string that contains the command line that opens the Control Panel item. This command line includes at least the name of the .cpl file. It can also contain any other necessary information such as the property sheet page within the item (either by ordinal or by name). For more information, see Executing Control Panel Items.
The handle of the parent window, used to display error messages about the opening of the item. This value can be NULL.

returns.para: TRUE if the Control Panel item was opened successfully; otherwise, FALSE.
As of Windows Vista, this function always returns FALSE.

member.name: Windows.SoftwareUpdateMessageBox
member.summary: Displays a standard message box that can be used to notify a user that an application has been updated.
member.param: A handle to the parent window.
The string value containing the identifier for the code distribution unit. For ActiveX controls, pszDistUnit is typically a GUID.
Reserved. Must be set to zero.
A pointer to a structure that, when this method returns successfully, receives the update information. The cbSize member must be initialized to the sizeof(SOFTDISTINFO).

returns.para: Returns one of the following values.

listheader.description: The user clicked the Do Not Update button on the dialog box.
The user clicked the Update Now or About Update button. The application should navigate to the HTML page referred to by the szHREF member of the structure pointed to by psdi.
There is no pending software update.
